sentences.english: Who could have predicted that within ten years hed be in charge of the whole company?
sentences.chinese: 誰曾能預料到在十年內他會成爲整個公司的負責人？

sentences.english: Recurvature follows after it traverses the ridge axis.
sentences.chinese: 預料尼伯特將於橫過副高脊線後開始轉向。

sentences.english: Dhaucer is buried in "poet's Dorner", as might have been expected.
sentences.chinese: 正如許多人已經預料的，喬叟被葬在“詩人角”。

sentences.english: He passed the examination, contrary to what I expected.
sentences.chinese: 他考試及格了，這出乎我的預料。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Benitez admits he is anticipating a tough encounter against Unirea in Bucharest.
sentences.chinese: 同時，貝尼特斯承認他預料在布加勒斯特是一場苦戰。

sentences.english: This lozenge has exceeded my expectations.
sentences.chinese: 這個糖丸超出我的預料。

sentences.english: The response to these in-roads by European competitors has been predictable.
sentences.chinese: 對歐洲競爭者的這些招數的迴應都是預料之中的。

sentences.english: It is the unforseen that always happen.
sentences.chinese: 發生的總是預料之外的。

sentences.english: That is entirely legitimate and it is to be expected.
sentences.chinese: 那也是完全合理的，而且是可以預料的。

sentences.english: We expect politicians to defame each other in an election year.
sentences.chinese: 我們預料政客們在選舉年會互相誹謗。

sentences.english: Yet it has generated entirely unanticipated social and business behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但是它產生了完全不曾預料到的社會和業務行爲。

sentences.english: So you would expect less lighting.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你應該預料不到的照明。

sentences.english: But what I didn't expect, were all of the small revelations sprinkled throughout.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個過程中貫穿的小發現卻是我所沒有預料到的。

sentences.english: Tepco has repeatedly called the combined disaster an event "beyond expectations."
sentences.chinese: 東電反覆稱這是一場無法預料的災難。

sentences.english: We expect to finish the delivery of your order in about three months.
sentences.chinese: 我們預料，此訂單，在三個月內可交清。

definition: auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
